response:
A young woman with subacute unilateral visual loss and RAPD without ocular motility or systemic deficits is most suggestive of inflammatory demyelinating optic neuritis, often associated with multiple sclerosis; alternative causes include NMOSD or MOGAD-related optic neuritis, ischaemic, compressive, granulomatous, hereditary, toxic/nutritional, and primary retinal pathologies.

differential_diagnosis = ["Demyelinating optic neuritis associated with multiple sclerosis (clinically isolated syndrome)", "Neuromyelitis optica spectrum disorder\u2013associated optic neuritis (AQP4-IgG positive)", "Myelin oligodendrocyte glycoprotein antibody\u2013associated optic neuritis (MOGAD)", "Idiopathic isolated demyelinating optic neuritis", "Non-arteritic anterior ischaemic optic neuropathy", "Compressive optic neuropathy (e.g., optic nerve sheath meningioma or orbital mass)", "Sarcoid-related optic neuropathy", "Toxic or nutritional optic neuropathy (e.g., vitamin B12 deficiency, medication-related)", "Leber hereditary optic neuropathy", "Retinal pathology causing unilateral visual loss (e.g., central retinal artery or vein occlusion, macular disease)"]
